projects.title: CLOUDOPENDATA
projects.description: The project aim and objective is to develop an Open Source Middleware, that through the use of open standards, allows the development of interoperable services for access and distribution of data between “cloud computing” service providers in a transparent way, using intelligent, self-operating procedures (techniques) of elasticity control and guaranteeing security to the data access as well as achieving simplicity on the development of data mashups.

Ingeniero de telecomunicaciones con máster técnico en big data, máster universitario en astrofísica y técnicas de observación astronómica, gestor de proyectos, especialista en impresión aditiva y en resolver problemas.

projects.title: European Grid Initiative
projects.description: The European Grid Infrastructure enables access to computing resources for European researchers from all fields of science, from High Energy Physics to Humanities.

contributors.headline: Director @ European Patent Office | Patents, Data, Knowledge, AI
Head of IT Logistics Solutions @ Migros Online
Head of Advanced Computing Department at University Computing Centre (SRCE)

projects.title: EGEE: Enabling Grids for E-sciencE
projects.description: The distributed computing infrastructure built and nurtured by the projects DataGrid (2002-2004), EGEE-I, -II and -III (2004-2010) is now supported by the European Grid Infrastructure. This long-term organisation coordinates National Grid Initiatives, which form the country-wide building blocks of the pan-European Grid. Transitioning the care of the infrastructure from EGEE to EGI is part of the process for ensuring a vibrant and sustained European research community.

authors.headline: Director @ European Patent Office | Patents, Data, Knowledge, AI

profile_positions.description:
- Leading, transforming and growing an IT department of +150 people in +10 locations, delivering +1000 data pipelines, +2 petabyte of data and great tools.
- Proud of the people working with me. :-)
- Re-engineered 428 applications and 20K+ COBOL files from an IBM Z mainframe into a cloud-native environment in 1 year.
- Implementing a culture of collaboration and innovation which allows quick failures, agile processes, and recognition.
- Leading and coaching managers.
- Fostering adoption of cloud-native technologies in a DevOps/NoOps approach.
- Applying a multi-cloud strategy on Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud.
- Driving Artificial Intelligence processes using neural networks, natural language processing, and computer vision.
- Sponsoring an innovation ecosystem that lowers the technical barriers and improves collaboration in data analytics, data engineering, and data science.
- Jury of the EPO CodeFest on application of AI to patents.
- Managing 20M€+ budgets.
- Programming languages: Python, Java, JavaScript, C++, Scala, and Groovy.
- Database stack: MongoDB, Scality, Redis, PostgreSQL and IBM DB2.
- Cloud stack: Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services, and Microsoft Azure.
- Other technologies: Jupyter, Kafka, Spring Cloud Data Flow, Apache Airflow, Kubernetes, Docker, ElasticSearch, Logstash, Kibana and more!
profile_positions.title: Head of Prior-art Data Management

profile_positions.description:
- Understanding at a deep technical level the current state-of-the-art in Financial Technologies: Blockchain, trading, risk management, banking systems, Google Pay, Apple Pay, VISA, MasterCard, etc.
- Expert in Blockchain, Cloud Computing, and Artificial Intelligence.
- Taking decisions on granting or refusing patent applications based on the state-of-the-art and law applicable.
- Performance coach.
- R&D in patent search and examination automation using Natural Language Processing and Neural Networks.
- Architect of a Pre-Search Neural Network which gives the correct X/Y closes state-of-the-art documents for +60% of EPO patent application searches.
- Developed a Natural Language Processing patent application analyzer that detects clarity objections under Article 84 EPC and amendments and basis under Article 123(2) EPC.
profile_positions.title: ICT Patent Examiner

profile_positions.description:
Main achievements:
- Lead and transform an IT team to provide efficient solutions and services
- Upgrade the infrastructure from 1 single rack to a hybrid cloud computing environment using internal (OpenStack) and external services (Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure)
- Implemented Google Workplace
- Internet of Things (IoT) for underwater vehicles and sensors.
- Implement Prince2 and ITILv3 in the organization
- Contribute to winning 3 EU projects with a budget > 12M€

Functions:
- Outsource non-core business IT services and expand in-house core business IT services
- Architect systems using Python and Java in Amazon Web Services, including data management systems and web-based systems with Django and HTML5
- Use MapReduce and Neural Networks for scientific data
- Manage service outsourcing
- Migrate to a hybrid private-public Cloud Computing infrastructure to control CAPEX vs OPEX
- Improve the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems
- Responsible for IP Strategy
- Apply Project Management using Prince2 and Scrum
- Apply Spanish and European privacy regulations (LOPD, 95/46/EC, Safe Harbor)
- Apply and adapt ITILv3 into the organization

Roles:
- Chairman of the Public Infrastructures as a Service Working Group at RedIRIS (> 400 R&D institutions in Spain)
- Co-Technical Coordinator of the CLOUD OPEN DATA FP7 project proposal (3.5M €)
- Team Manager for ICT of the TROPOS FP7 project (7M €)
- Project Manager for several ICT European Project proposals (> 1M € each)
- Secretary of the Energy and Sustainability Forum at the University of Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
profile_positions.title: IT Director

profile_positions.description:
Main Achievements:
- Architect a federated grid/cloud computing testing system which controlled the resources of 352 data processing centers around the world, > 10M cores and > 15 petabytes of storage.
- Editor and co-author of the GLUEv2 Grid Computing standard.

Functions:
- To be a member of the GLUE International Working Group to develop and implement GLUE 2.0 Specifications for Grid Interoperability.
- Collaborate with distributed development teams worldwide.
- To be the Technical Leader of the MyEGI/MyWLGC project.
- Service Manager of the MyEGI/MyWLGC project using ITILv3.
- To be the Central monitoring DB representative in the Operational Tools Advisory Group for EGI
- To be part of the Information System Product Team for the LHC Computing Grid, including development of BDII and GStat.
- To be part of the Service Availability Monitoring Team for the LHC Computing Grid.
- To be a release manager for the Service Availability Monitoring framework.
- Some of the technologies I am using in my work are Python (including Django), Java (J2SE and J2EE), Perl, MySQL and Oracle. I also use sometimes PHP (including Zend Framework), OpenLDAP and Bash.
- Project management with Prince2.

English and French working environment.

1st prize in "Creating Secure Software Contest" and special distinction in "Big Data Technologies Contest" at CERN School of Computing.

profile_positions.description:
Master Thesis with 10 out of 10 graduated with the highest honors (summa cum laude).

"Usability and Accessibility Study of an eLearning Web Platform: MOODLE"

Content:
- Accesibility protocols and international legislation
- Accesibility study of a web application
- Review of usability methods
- Usability study of a web application
- Optimizing response time in web applications
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer (Master Thesis)

profile_positions.company: Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria
profile_positions.description:
Teaching both online and blended learning courses on:
- Natural Language Processing
- Web Accessibility and Usability
- Python and Django
- Java
- Work Collaboration Tools
- Human-Computer Interaction

During this time, I also worked as a freelance:
- Developing and Optimizing web applications
- Accessibility and usability studies
- Technical Reviewer of the book "Moodle Multimedia"
- Machine Learning prototypes

Services offered both as a consultant and as a teacher. Clients:
- Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria (www.ulpgc.es)
- Canary Islands Pediatric Association (www.sepexpal.org)
- Packt Publishing (www.packtpub.com)
- Several local SMEs
profile_positions.title: Part-Time Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Main Achievements:
- Developed a tool for Subversion Source Code Management for more than 300 projects worldwide.
- Cluster Configuration Management using Quattor and Service Level Agreement (SLA) Monitorization using Lemon.

Other:
Technologies used: Java, Bash, Perl, LDAP, Scientific Linux, Ubuntu and SOAP Web Services.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer (Openlab Research)

profile_positions.description:
Development
- Design and implementation of the core of a virtual private network for mobile operators using intelligent networks. Refactoring of other people´s code to improve readability, which improved maintainability of the code for fast bug solving response.
- Technologies and standards used: Linux, J2SE, J2EE, Eclipse, ClearCase, ClearQuest, MS Project, INS, CS1, CAMEL, LDAP.

Testing
- Design and implement Unit Tests with JUnit and Functional Tests with proprietary tools which helped to catch bugs and detect interaction problems in the SS7 and SIP messaging protocol stacks.

Project Management
- Project management and technical coordination of 8 external consultants.
- Perform feasibility studies.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Mentor at the Google Summer of Code 2008 for Moodle. Leading two projects:
- Detecting and solving specific usability issues
- Automatic accessibility checking using purely Javascript and checking against the W3C validator with their SOAP API

Attended the Google Summer of Code Mentor Summit at Googleplex in representation of Moodle.

Mentor at the Google Summer of Code 2007 for Moodle. I managed a project called Moodle Voice to navigate with your voice through a web application using the VoiceXML technology.
profile_positions.title: Summer of Code Mentor

profile_positions.description: Architect and develop an eLearning system for the University based on Moodle, PHP and LDAP. Train the professors and teachers in its usage.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer (internship)

profile_positions.description:
Development of a Java applet to browse through a graphical network using XML-RPC. Refactorization of its code to improve readability and apply design patterns. 

Development of an XML-RPC server in Ruby which allows you to navigate through a database.

Development of SARA (Sistema de Asistencia Remota Automatizada - Automated Remote Assistance System) based on UltraVNC for remote PC assistance.

Write down client and internal documentation for different projects in both English and Spanish.
